channel.title: Comments on: And The Point Of Safari For Windows Is…

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: You're right. Porting an app from OSX to Windows is no small task since you would need to use a different API. It's not simply a matter of just recompiling.
item.content:encoded: You’re right. Porting an app from OSX to Windows is no small task since you would need to use a different API. It’s not simply a matter of just recompiling.

item.title: By: ahura mazda
item.dc:creator: ahura mazda
item.content:encoded:
“Now that Apple moved to the Intel platform porting applications to Windows requires a whole lot less work”

Please explain how it less work to porting to Windows now. I don’t know much about Mac apps, but I do know about Window apps.

thanx.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: I kind of like Safari's icon. And benchmark wise it is rather sleepy. Although Firefox 3 is getting better with each beta release.
item.content:encoded: I kind of like Safari’s icon. And benchmark wise it is rather sleepy. Although Firefox 3 is getting better with each beta release.

item.title: By: andro
item.dc:creator: andro
item.description:
things i hate
safari
why because of lag on my computer.
the end. also safari doesn't have a cool icon.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Well it certainly doesn''t take much time to get things looking right in a standards compliance browser like Safari. Most of the weird quirks show up in Safari 2.
item.content:encoded: Well it certainly doesn”t take much time to get things looking right in a standards compliance browser like Safari. Most of the weird quirks show up in Safari 2.

item.title: By: Paulo
item.dc:creator: Paulo
item.description: The main purpose of Safari on Windows is to provide more billable hours for freelance web designers to get their designs right in yet another browser.
item.content:encoded: The main purpose of Safari on Windows is to provide more billable hours for freelance web designers to get their designs right in yet another browser.
